title: @Meddler, @RiotRepertior, you should make Sona a bit less about poke
body:
And more about enchanting

This is the identity that I tie this champion with and the identity that I wanna feel when I play her, AOE enchanting (and also the identity that her kit is trying to portray)

That is all

replies.body: The thing is that, even with her reworked aura procs, Sona standing around and making her allies win the game with free stats is incredibly uninteractive for Sona and her opponents at all stages of the game. She actually already has quite a bit of power in her auras that people don't realize how much it adds up over the course of a fight.

> The thing is that, even with her reworked aura procs, Sona standing around and making her allies win the game with free stats is incredibly uninteractive for Sona and her opponents at all stages of the game. 

That's the play style an "aura champion" does promise though.

LoL already has plenty of champions that are flat out better at poking things to death than Sona, and plenty of champions with better core aesthetics centered around poking things to death.

Sona is a champion that looks like she grants auras and she's does it so poorly her mediocre poke is the only thing that really stands out. Especially considering Nami's kit overlaps hers pretty hard, and Sona's poke is the only thing that really stands out in that comparison. 

Sona's core aesthetic really is one of a character that enhances allies and enchants her enemies with music as well. 
You can argue aura's don't fit that, but at her core: Sona really should be all about enchanting.

>
> Sona is a champion that looks like she grants auras and she's does it so poorly

She's already the champion you want her to be but you don't realize it.

But one of her problems is how reliant on AP she is

Because of how much AP she needs to actually work, if she doesn't get it then she's fucked, her base numbers aren't doing it because they've been nerfed

It feels terrible getting behind on Sona at the moment, especially because you're playing a support champion and because of that, is expected to make a come back for your team

As a Sona main, I don't really agree with the sentiment that she's AP Reliant. Considering that not a single ratio of her goes above 50%. (collectively, her spell, aura, and powerchord would, but she doesn't have a solo spell that heavy.) And I mainly point this out, because we are picking up lichbane and Luden's over a death cap. (But those two items are good for other reasons, not just poke)

I also state this because of her Early game. If I'm not directly countered, I find that I can win most matchups in the early game. 

As for your original Question. Improving Sona's auras would likely turn the game too much into a stat's check for her team. The only way you could add counterplay to that is if you had to chose your targets. This would be counter intuitive for her Auras, but it would work great with her powerchord mechanic.

And that's where I feel like more room for supportive features can come from. Right now, her Q-powerchord is basically goto for her. Increasing her damage from her powercord, (Which affects towers by the way.) without really worrying about her teammates capitalizing on it. (Compared to her other two chords, which are a limited duration damage debuff, and a slow) One idea I had was turning it into a defense shred, (of similar duration as the other powerchords) allow it to increase you allies damage to a particular target.

I have rarely found it the case that a team will all in with Sona out of range of the fight starting, but within range that she can turn around and hard counter the initiation.  

With the level of mobility in the game, slowing a champion who is out of position is not enough to secure a kill.  If I could chain the slow, maybe, but as is its not enough.

The assassin let you get off the empowered W before blowing their cool downs?  That is a very bad assassin.

The movement speed would be fine if it wasn't limited by both a long base cool down and a super short duration.

Censer is another thing I see a lot of people point to.  The issue is that it's almost always a bad choice on Sona.  There are very very few team comps that it's beneficial to give the buff to your allies (at least to the level people think it would)

{{item:3048}} Mana, ap and shield.
{{item:3025}} Armor, CDR, some damage and a slow for an engage or disengage.
{{item:3065}} Improved healing with some CDR, HP and Magic Resist. 
{{item:1307}} + E, to get close enough to Q or just auto you before they run away.

cunning: **Windspeaker's Blessing** better healing and defenses for team.

It's healthier for her targeted play-style and more thematically sound as a music-player, and they'd probably be more willing to buff base stats and give her less reliance on AP to go with it.

More aura-based gameplay that worked in tandem with it would be great, too.

As a former Sona main, I'm actually pretty happy with Sona's gameplay.  The poke is a nice early game deterrent, and the rest of her kit really shines in late game play.  What she mostly suffers from is a lack of good support itemization synergy.  Ardent censor is pretty much the only thing that gets her support boosties.  Would like more interaction with her buffs.
I would gladly trade her poke for CC/Peel and better defensive base stats.

>I would gladly trade her poke for CC/Peel and better defensive base stats.

That still wouldn't make her good, if you replaced Q with something like a Bard Q and lowered her passive damage she'd just be a worse Janna rather than a worse Nami.

Sona honestly just needs peel added to her current kit. She doesn't need compensation nerfs for it, she's a weak champion with no real niche who's desperately in need of a reason to be picked.

I'd say what should be done with her is change her Q into a 2 charge skillshot so the mouthbreathers stop complaining about her "OP auto target harass", even though a skill shot is actually stronger than autotarget harass it would make her seem less powerful to the bronzies who somehow manage to aim skillshots at their towers. Then replace her E with an actual spell. The spell portion of her E (not the aura) is literally the most pathetic spell in the game right now. Her W and Q aren't terrible when you ignore the aura, her E is a speed boost which does literally nothing since the aura already pushes her over the cap. If she had an actual spell on her E, preferably one she could peel with even if it's situational rather than just the aura there might actually be a reason to pick her.
I've been saying this for a while. Aria needs a good bit of its initial burst shifted to the aura, including some AP ratio.

Her pre-rework gameplay did exactly what you described.
Riot could rework her and make her work similar to Invoker.

>Her pre-rework gameplay did exactly what you described.

Her auras now are far weaker than they were pre rework. The main difference is that with pre rework Sona your expected result with each aura was to hit 5 people, since the range was quite large. Because of this her old Q and W auras had a combined gold value of around 10k. 

Sona's new "auras" probably need to hit at least 3 people to even out this gold value, but that's before you account for the massive kit nerfs she took when she took when she received these "auras". In order for new Sona to be as effective as old Sona you probably need to hit your entire team with your "auras", which is super unrealistic. 

So no, right now she's really not a better 'enchanter' than she was pre rework.
I didn't even say anything about her being a better enchanter right now than pre-rework.On the contrary she was way better before the rework.

She used to be more about Auras and enchanting. He Auras were actually permanent until you cast another spell. Then they reworked her to be more about poke and temporary buffs. They also reduced her range. Also her ult was made thinner. Then they made her abilities cost more. Then they reduced the damage on her Q. Then they reduced her heal potential. Even ARAM got nerfs to how heal mechanics work on that map with reference to Sona in the patch notes.

There is a silver lining though: They eventually reduced the mana cost on her Ult.

Sona's new persona is about poke, and it's a rather healthy lane mechanic so I don't think it should change. I was a Sona main for several seasons, and you can really play her however you want. If you want to focus on enchanting, then max W and E while building ancient coin.
